meanings.definition: The act of adjusting or calibrating an instrument or machine to achieve the desired performance.
meanings.sent1: The tuning of the guitar made it sound just right.
meanings.sent2: She spent hours tuning the piano to make it play beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The robot's tuning was so precise that it danced perfectly to the music.
meanings.sent4: His tuning of the engine was like a symphony, each part working in harmony.
meanings.sent5: The tuning of the violin was so skillful that it brought tears to the audience's eyes.

meanings.definition: The process of making small changes to improve the accuracy or effectiveness of something.
meanings.sent1: After some tuning, the website's performance improved significantly.
meanings.sent2: Regular tuning of the machine ensured it ran smoothly without errors.
meanings.sent3: The chef's tuning of the recipe resulted in a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: Her tuning of the presentation made it engaging and informative.
meanings.sent5: The tuning of the microscope allowed for clearer observations of the cells.

meanings.definition: The adjustment of a radio or television receiver to receive a particular frequency or channel.
meanings.sent1: He did the tuning on the radio to find his favorite station.
meanings.sent2: The quick tuning of the TV helped them catch the news on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed fascinated by the tuning of the radio, trying to catch the sound.
meanings.sent4: Her mind needed some tuning to focus on the right channel of thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The precise tuning of the radio dial brought in the clearest music.
